content.description: Start with hands low in the higher, thinner crack and climb up to top out on the horn. Committing moves higher up, as the problem is decently high.
content.location: Around the corner to the right on Fanger Slapper

content.description: Start in the lowest left slot/crack under the Uptown Crack.  Move straight up the arete
Start at the far left of the boulder on a jug/sloper, traverse right, and exit at the right end of the roof.  Use slopers and hand jams under the roof, and either thin feet or heel hooks.
content.location: Halfway through the Hogs Pen, right off the trail, is a 5' high boulder about 20' wide, with a roof that looks like it might slip right off

content.description: Start in cave with hands in sloped pockets and move up to lip. Then traverse right on the lip to top out.
content.location: In the cave directly right of Flamer

content.description: Great, easy problem. Begin in the center of the boulder, with hands in horizontal, right rising crack. Climb up the boulder however you want (left arete, face only, right arete and face, etc.) and grab the jug directly over the top to top out.
content.location: From Flamer, follow the trail (rocks on your right) all the way to the end of the boulder field. The problem is on the last boulders, specifically on the rock shaped like Pac Man with his mouth open right, ready to "eat" the smaller stone next to him.

content.description: If you can't climb slab you will swear on your mother's life this is NOT v1. Make a move off good holds to greet a blank face. Move up through tiny crimps, divots and knobs until the rock levels off. Jog to the top. The small tree behind the climber provides an opportunity to bail at any time. Exciting!!
content.protection: 2-3 pads. The climb is tall, but the landing is flat.
content.location: The climb is directly behind Pac Man's Lunch. Begin where a sharp flake protrudes from a crack two feet left of a tree growing out of the rock. Climb straight up initially, then move directly in front of the tree to follow the line of holds (that barely exists).

content.description: Begin under the overhang with a high left hand. Move right through razor sharp holds and top out at the right end of the boulder. Several flakes have fallen off the lower part of the climb, which now leaves the climber with several options for footholds. Sharp rock, but awesome powerful movement.
content.location: On the overhang around the corner from Uptown Crack.

content.description: A long, left-to-right traverse of the featured face. Very footwork intensive problem. Top out straight up once you run out of boulder to traverse.
content.location: The problem is found on the wide face 25 feet left of Fanger Slapper.

content.description: Beautiful, shady area graced with TONS of good rock. Hogs Pen holds the most potential out of any spot at Cedar lake. Small caves, to sick cracks, to brutal traverses, with some highballs thrown in the mix for sure. The area is broken into two sections. The main spot is the first group of rocks and cliffs you come to walking in. If you continue walking on this path however, and cruise straight past these boulders you will come to another big, well featured cliff face with several smaller boulders scattered on the ground around it. The latter has definite top roping possibilities. Much development to be had here.
